title: Face scabies in the elderly: when dermoscopy can be a game changer
details: A Corio, E Zelin, V Mazzoletti, B Sonego, C Brunello… - Dermatology Reports, 2024
abstract: Scabies is a common pruritic ectoparasitic infestation of the skin caused by the mite Sarcoptes scabiei. It classically presents as an intensely pruritic eruption that usually involves hands and interdigital folds, wrists, axillae, areolae, abdomen, and genitalia …
